lead_paragraph: Indiana Pacers forward Jermaine O’Neal has not demanded a trade to the Los Angeles Lakers, but he remains open to the idea. While O’Neal has been the subject of trade talk since the Pacers missed the playoffs for the first time in 10 years, the discussion was stirred up yesterday when SI.com quoted O’Neal as saying he would “welcome a trade to the Lakers” and mentioned the Nets as another option.O’Neal, a six-time All-Star, played down the trade talk in a later interview.“I don’t think me saying I’d like to go with those teams is me saying I want to be traded,” he said.O’Neal, who averaged 19.4 points and 9.6 rebounds last season, said he recognized that the Pacers were rebuilding with young players and that he might not be part of their plans, but that he was happy to stay.
